uk.ac.sanger.cgp.autocsa.analysis

Class SeqTraceAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.sanger.cgp.autocsa.analysis.SeqTraceAnalysis

  • public class SeqTraceAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object

    Workhorse Class for Sequence Trace Analysis operations.

    Original author: Ed Dicks
    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:
    $Author$

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeqTraceAnalysis

        public SeqTraceAnalysis(int np,
                int refStart,
                int refEnd,
                int[] minAmp,
                int minDist)
        Allocates a SeqTraceAnalysis object.
        Parameters:
        np - No of data points in analysis, i.e. No of peaks in trace.
        refStart - base No to start Amplimer matching
        refEnd - base No to stop Amplimer matching
        minAmp - int[4] array of minimum intensities for each channel that were used for peak detection.
        minDist - minimum distance between peaks used in peak detection.

        Parameters:
        isTumour - flag whether trace is a Normal or Tumour

        Returns:
        array (4) of min peak intensities (order is GATC)

        public int getMinPeakIntensity(java.lang.String base)
        Getter for Min peak intensity used in peak detection for a channel
        Parameters:
        base - channel to select i.e. one of A,C,G,T
        Returns:
        min peak intensity for the specified channel

      • setTraceQuality

        public void setTraceQuality(int peakRange)

        Sets the individual base trace quality array.

        Note the analysis datasets must have been sorted before calling this method.

        Method uses a per base Signal to Noise ratio.

        Parameters:
        peakRange - Deprecated not required

      • getTraceQualityUsingPeaksOnly

        public float[] getTraceQualityUsingPeaksOnly(float maxQual,
                                    int bin)

        Returns a trace quality array calculated using peak data only.

        Note the analysis datasets must have been sorted before calling this method.

        Method uses a Peak Signal to Peak Noise ratio at a base location.

        Parameters:
        maxQual - the max allowable quality value
        bin - the half length of the search window for noise peaks
        Returns:
        float array of quality values

      • getTraceQualityOverWindow

        public float[] getTraceQualityOverWindow(int peakRange,
                                float maxQual)

        Returns a trace quality array calculated over a window.

        Note the analysis datasets must have been sorted before calling this method.

        Method uses a Signal to Noise ratio over a window of bases.

        Parameters:
        peakRange - the window size (bases)
        maxQual - the max allowable quality value
        Returns:
        float array of quality values

      • getTraceQuality

        public float[] getTraceQuality()
        Returns the trace quality array.
        Returns:
        float array of quality values

      • getAverageTraceQuality

        public float getAverageTraceQuality()

        Returns the average trace quality.

        Note calculated over the ROI if set.

        Returns:
        the average trace quality

      • getQualityProfile

        public float getQualityProfile(float critQuality)

        Returns the % of bases with quality above a critical value.

        Note calculated over the ROI if set.

        Parameters:
        critQuality - the critical quality value
        Returns:
        the % of bases with q > critQuality

        Returns an array containing the analysis limits.

        Note if the base is not in the analysis then returns -1.

        Setter of ArrayList of trace holes.

        Note trace holes are amplimer bases not matched with trace peaks.

        Parameters:

      • setAnalysisParams

        public void setAnalysisParams(float bin,
                     int refstart,
                     int refend,
                     int refinc,
                     int maxmiss,
                     int mindist)

        Setter of class analysis parameters.

        Parameters:
        bin - the scan length to use for the window for peak searching
        refstart - the start base No for amplimer matching
        refend - the end base No for amplimer matching
        maxmiss - the max allowable No of bases to miss in the amplimer
        mindist - Deprecated has no function

      • getROIArrayIndices

        public int[] getROIArrayIndices()

        Calculate and get of array indices corresponding to the set ROI.

        Note returns [0,0] if the ROI is not set.

        Returns:
        the array indices of the ROI coordinates

      • getTraceStatus

        public int getTraceStatus()

        Return an integer code for the trace status.

        Note any trace status is based on the ROI if set.

        Note the trace status integer codes are set in Constants.

        Returns:
        integer code trace status

      • getBaseScans

        Getter for the int array of scan indices of base positions.

      • getAverageBaseSpacing

        public float getAverageBaseSpacing(int pos,
                          int nBases)

        Calculate and return a value for the average base spacing over the specified number of proceeding bases.

        Note returns -1.0 if calculation tries to use unanalysed regions.

        Parameters:
        pos - the base position
        nBases - the number of proceeding bases
        Returns:
        the average base spacing

      • getNumViablePeaks

        public int getNumViablePeaks(int scan1,
                    int scan2,
                    int viableCrit)

        Calculate and return the number of Viable peaks in a scan index range .

        Note A viable peak is defined as a peak deemed by CSA to be potentially associated with an amplimer base, and a peak in the scan range must be > 20 % of the max peak in the same range.

        Parameters:
        scan1 - the start scan index
        scan2 - the end scan index
        viableCrit - Depracated Not currently used
        Returns:
        the number of viable peaks

      • getBaseQuality

        public float getBaseQuality(int pos)

        Gets the quality value for a specified base number.

        Note returns -1 if base has not been analysed.

        Parameters:
        pos - the base position
        Returns:
        the base quality value (Signal : Noise ratio)

      • getScanAtBase

        public int getScanAtBase(int pos)

        Gets the scan index for a specified base number.

        Note returns -1 if base has not been analysed.

        Parameters:
        pos - the base position
        Returns:
        the base scan index value

      • setROICoords

        public void setROICoords(int start,
                int end)

        Sets the ROI coordinates for this class.

        Parameters:
        start - the starting ROI coordinate
        end - the ending ROI coordinate

      • getLocalTrueChannelQuality

        public float getLocalTrueChannelQuality(int pos,
                               java.lang.String base,
                               int windowHalfLen)

        Calculates and gets the true local quality for a specified base type and region of a trace.

        Note here true local quality refers to the fact that we ignore any mutant (het) peaks in the range and consider only genuine noise.

        Parameters:
        pos - the base position
        base - the base type (channel) to consider
        windowHalfLen - the half length of the window around the base
        Returns:
        the true local quality

      • searchChannelForPeak

        public int[] searchChannelForPeak(java.lang.String searchBase,
                         int searchLimit1,
                         int searchLimit2,
                         float intensityFactor)

      • searchForDyeBlobs

        public int searchForDyeBlobs(int windowStart,
                    int windowWidth,
                    float critIntensityRatio)

        Searches for Dye Blobs over a specified base range, and if found then resets the base q to zero, returns the number of bases affected.

        Parameters:
        windowStart - the start base to search for dye blobs
        windowWidth - the window width (added to windowStart to define a window) to search for dye blobs (bases)
        critIntensityRatio - multiplier for the average channel intensity to define a critical intensity for a dye blob
        Returns:
        the number of bases affected by dye blob

      • getModifiedBaseQuality

        private float getModifiedBaseQuality(int index,
                           float critIntensity)

      • getAveragePeakIntensity

        private float getAveragePeakIntensity(char base,
                            int index1,
                            int index2)

      • setModifiedQwhereUnderloaded

        public void setModifiedQwhereUnderloaded()
        Sets the base quality value to zero at every Underloaded base

      • setModifiedQwhereOverloaded

        public void setModifiedQwhereOverloaded()
        Sets the base quality value to zero at every Overloaded base

      • isBaseDyeBlob

        public boolean isBaseDyeBlob(int baseNum)
        Returns a boolean to indicate whether base is affected by Dye Blob
        Parameters:
        baseNum - the base number
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if base is Dye Blob affected

      • isBaseUnderloaded

        public boolean isBaseUnderloaded(int targetPos)
        Returns a boolean to indicate whether base is Underloaded. Note If base is not analysed then returns false.
        Parameters:
        targetPos - the base number
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if base is Underloaded

      • isBaseOverloaded

        public boolean isBaseOverloaded(int targetPos,
                       int critIntensity)
        Returns a boolean to indicate whether base is Overloaded. Note If base is not analysed then returns false.
        Parameters:
        targetPos - the base number
        critIntensity - if this value > 0 then this is used as the critical intensity
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if base is Overloaded

      • checkQualityProfileForInDel

        public int checkQualityProfileForInDel(boolean roiOnly)
        Returns an indication of whether there is an Het Indel in the trace. Method uses a ratio of the average quality over left and right windows. Note If there is not enough data points to work with then returns zero.
        Parameters:
        roiOnly - boolean specifying whether to consider ROI region only
        Returns:
        position of start of suspected Indel, otherwise zero

      • getScansOfInsertedBases

        public int[] getScansOfInsertedBases(java.lang.String bases,
                            int StartScan)

        Finds the int array of scan indices of Inserted base positions.

        Note the bases must have been set to "Inserted" type to be recognised.

        Parameters:
        bases - the String array of Inserted bases
        StartScan - the scan from which to start the search
        Returns:
        the int array of Inserted base scan indices
